intro: Psammetes madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar sand mat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the wet season. It is adapted to sandy soils and can tolerate drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
